question: Does Quran contradicts itself regarding Power of Allah
answer:
QUESTION
As Salaamu Alaikum Mufti. Please can you clearify this. I know we are not allowed, or should I say learnered enough to make Tafseer of the direct translation of the Holy Qur'aan. But in surah Qaf, ayat 37 (50:37) and I do quote " and verily we have created the heavens and the earth, and all that which is in between, in six days, and naught of weariness touched us" Who is the "US" and "WE" that Allah is refering to?For a person who wishes to confuse us, they may use these verses to say there is more than One Allah (Astagfirulallah).Also please explain why Allah says he created the Heavens and the Earth in 6 days.I was brought up with 1 thing drilled into me and that being ALLAH SAYS AND IT WILL BE.Please clearify.Jazakallah Shukran.Was Salaam
ANSWER


Share:

The word we is also an expression of power and strength. All power belongs to Allah and thus the expression of We and Us in the Quran.

 

 

2)         There are two verses in Quran. One is that Allah created the world in six days and the other verse is where Allah intends to do anything, He says and it is.

 

            The creating of the world in 6 days is not contrary to intending beyond time. Allah has the power to do that as well. Allah is also Al-Hakeem (the Wise one). Every act of Allah is filled with wisdom. He could have created the world in split seconds but instead He did it in 6 days. One of the possible wisdom behind Allah doing that is to emphasize on the importance of time. One should not be hasty in major issues. Rasul Allah sallallahu Alayhi wasalam said, to be careful and cautious is from Allah and to be hasty is from Shaytan.

 

 

And Allah Ta'ala knows best

 

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
